wikitext.*:
'''TAW''', or '''TAWA''', is a [[Primitive Quendian]] [[Sundocarme|root]] signifying "wood".<ref name=PE17>{{PE|17}}, pp. 115, 187 (root appearing as "√TAW-")</ref><ref>{{VT|39a}}, p. 7 (root appearing as "*TAWA")</ref>

==Derivatives==

*[[Common Eldarin]]: ''tau-rē'' ("forest")<ref name=PE17/>
**[[Quenya]]: ''[[taure]]''<ref name=PE17/>
**[[Sindarin]]: ''[[taur#Sindarin|taur]]''<ref name=PE17/>

*[[Quenya]]: ''töa'' ("wood as material"); ''tauka'' ("stiff, wooden"); ''toina'' ("wood - of material" or "wooden of make")<ref name=PE17/>
*[[Sindarin]]: ''taw'' ("wood as material"); ''tāva'' ("great tree"); ''tawen, tewin'' ("wood - of material" or "wooden of make"); ''taug'' ("firm, strong")<ref name=PE17/>

==Other versions of the legendarium==

In the ''Qenya Lexicon'' appears the root TAVA, signifying "beam".<ref>{{PE|12}}</ref> In the [[The Etymologies|''Etymologies'']] appears the root TÁWAR-, signifying "wood, forest".<ref>{{LR|Etymologies}}, p. 391</ref>
